She signed with [[Big Machine Records]] at the age of 15.{{cite news |last1=Turner |first1=Rianna |title=Teen Callista Clark Is A Rising Country Radio Star |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/riannaturner/2021/02/12/teen-callista-clark-is-a-rising-country-radio-star/ |access-date=19 February 2021 |work=Forbes |date=12 February 2021 |archive-date=13 February 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210213040701/https://www.forbes.com/sites/riannaturner/2021/02/12/teen-callista-clark-is-a-rising-country-radio-star/ |url-status=live }} ==Career== Callista Clark released her first EP on February 12, 2021 with [[Big Machine Records]], entitled ''[[Real to Me (EP)|Real to Me]]''. Clark co-wrote all 5 songs on the EP, which was produced by [[Nathan Chapman (record producer)|Nathan Chapman]].{{cite news |last1=Papadatos |first1=Markos |title=Meet Callista Clark: Rising teen country singer-songwriter |url=http://www.digitaljournal.com/entertainment/music/meet-callista-clark-rising-teen-country-singer-songwriter/article/585423 |access-date=19 February 2021 |work=Digital Journal |date=12 February 2021 |archive-date=13 February 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210213080544/http://www.digitaljournal.com/entertainment/music/meet-callista-clark-rising-teen-country-singer-songwriter/article/585423 |url-status=live }} "[[It's 'Cause I Am]]" impacted [[country radio]] as the EP's lead single on March 29, 2021. "It's 'Cause I Am" was described by ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' critic Tom Roland as "mining the clash between others' perception of her outward teen appearance and her inner reality", calling her voice's [[timbre]] "older than her chronological age".{{cite magazine |last1=Roland |first1=Tom |title=Makin' Tracks: Old-Soul Callista Clark Raitts Highly On Debut Single, 'It's 'Cause I Am' By Tom Roland |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/country/9551410/callista-clark-its-cause-i-am-single-radio |access-date=26 July 2021 |magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] |date=14 April 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210726024203/https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/country/9551410/callista-clark-its-cause-i-am-single-radio |archive-date=26 July 2021 |url-status=live}} The song reached as high as 22 on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Country Airplay]] chart.{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/charts/country-airplay/2021-11-06|title=Country Airplay: November 6, 2021|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|access-date=November 2, 2021|url-access=subscription}} In an interview with Country Now on May 19, 2021, Clark said that she had "tons of songs from [the beginning of her career] to where I am now that I'm just dying to put out", hinting towards the possible release of new music. On July 30, 2021, Clark debuted at the [[Grand Ole Opry]]. influences=== Callista Clark has said that, while growing up, she listened to country music from the 1980s and the 1990s, citing artists such as [[Travis Tritt]], [[Randy Travis]] and [[The Judds]] as inspirations, also mentioning that she was a fan of [[Ingrid Andress]]' songwriting and confidence. Clark has named [[Luke Combs]] and [[Thomas Rhett]] as musicians that she admires, saying that "it would mean the world to me to be successful as a writer of my own songs and even for other artists, just like [Combs and Rhett] do".
